intro: Lippia pedunculata, commonly known as Mexican blueweed, is a flowering plant native to Central America and parts of the southern United States. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, blue or purple flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Lippia pedunculata is also valued for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
